info.title: Server to Server Cart API
info.description:
### Cart
Allows for a cart to be created using BigCommerce cart logic. The existing BigCommerce front end cart can be bypassed.

Notes:
- cartId is the same as the checkoutId.
- Carts are valid for 30 days from the last modification. This can include creating the cart or editing the cart.
- Redirect URLs can be generated only from carts created using the server-to-server cart API. To restore a cart that was created on the storefront–either by a shopper or the Storefront Cart API–first recreate the cart using the server-to-server Cart API.

post.description:
Creates a *Cart*. 

**Required Fields**
* line_items object
* custom_items object -- If adding a item that does not already exist in the store
* gift_certificates object -- Only if adding a gift certificate to for shopper purchase

**Notes**

*Cart* ID is generated in the response.

To create a redirect_url upon *Cart* creation use the query param: `include=redirect_urls`

A cart can be created using an existing catalog item, or by adding a custom item using [Item Custom](/api-reference/cart-checkout/server-server-cart-api/models/itemcustom).

Cart ID is the same as the checkout ID.

Carts are valid for 30 days from the last modification. This can include creating the cart or editing the cart.

Redirect URLs can be generated only from carts created using the Server to Server Cart API. To restore a cart that was created on the storefront, either by a shopper or the Storefront Cart API, first recreate the cart using the Server to Server Cart API.

parameters.name: cartData

variant_id.description: Required if the product has variants

items.title: Line Item Gift Certificate Request Data

name.description: Given name for gift certificate line item.

message.description: Message shown to recipient, as provided by sender.

channel_id.description: If no channel is specified, defaults to 1.

parameters.description:
1. Creating a cart by adding a simple product (a product without option selections)
2. Creating a cart with a variant. This works when a product can be specified purely by a variant, without any other required options.
3. With a variant and a checkbox and picklist modifier added.
4. Using a Custom Item

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

post.description:
Adds a line items to the *Cart*

**Notes**

To add a custom item use [Item Custom](/api-reference/cart-checkout/server-server-cart-api/models/itemcustom).

variant_id.description: Required if the product has variants

name.description: Given name for gift certificate line item.

message.description: Message shown to recipient, as provided by sender.

items.title: Line Item Gift Certificate Request Data

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

post.description:
Creates a *Cart* redirect URL. Create a URL to redirect a shopper to an already created cart using the `cartId`.

**Notes**

A *Carts* redirect URLs may only be used once. Once a redirect URL has been visited, it will be invalidated and cannot be used again. If your application requires URLs to be visited more than once, consider generating a fresh one each time you need to restore a cart, and redirecting to the URL from your own application.

Redirect URLs can be generated only from carts created using the Server to Server Cart API. To restore a cart that was created on the storefront, either by a shopper or the Storefront Cart API, first recreate the cart using the Server to Server Cart API.

put.description:
Updates a *Cart* line item. Updates an existing, single line item in the cart. 

**Notes**
Currently only updating the item price and quantity are supported.

If a variant needs to be changed or updated, the product will need to be removed and re-added to the cart with the correct variants using the Add Cart Line Items endpoint.

variant_id.description: Required if the product has variants

name.description: Given name for gift certificate line item.

message.description: Message shown to recipient, as provided by sender.

gift_certificate.title: Line Item Gift Certificate Request Data

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

delete.description:
Deletes a *Cart* line item. 

**Notes**

Removing the last `line_item` in the *Cart* deletes the *Cart*.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

204.description: If the action's result is an empty cart, the cart gets automatically deleted.

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: The identifier of a specific cart.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

put.description:
Updates a *Carts* `customer_id`.

**Notes**

Changing the *Cart* `customer_id` will remove any promotions or shipping on the *Cart*. These are tied to the customer depending on cart conditions and any customer groups.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

delete.description: Deletes a *Cart*. Once a *Cart* has been deleted it can not be recovered.

Cart.description: A cart contains a collection of items, prices, discounts, etc.. It does not contain customer-related data.

id.description: Cart ID, provided after creating a cart with a POST.

parent_id.description: Bundled items will have their parent's item Id.

customer_id.description: ID of the customer to which the cart belongs.

email.description: The cart's email. This is the same email that is used in the billing address

currency.description: This will always be the same between cart and checkout.
currency.title: Currency

base_amount.description: Cost of cart's contents, before applying discounts.

cart_amount.description: Sum of line-items amounts, minus cart-level discounts and coupons. This amount includes taxes (where applicable).

items.title: Applied Discount

id.description: ID of the applied discount. Will return

variant_id.description: The id of the variant. Required in the /PUT or /POST if the product has variants.

product_id.description: The id of the product. Required in a /POST

name.description: The item's product name.

quantity.description: Quantity of this item in the cart.

image_url.description: Image of the product or variant.

items.title: Applied Discount

id.description: ID of the applied discount. Will return

code.description: The coupon code. Required in a /POST request.

name.description: Name given to the coupon in the Control Panel

discountType.description:
The discount type.

- type 0: per_item_discount
- type 1: percentage_discount
- type 2: per_total_discount
- type 3: shipping_discount
- type 4: free_shipping

discountAmount.description: The amount of the discount based on the coupoon. For example 3 percent off will show a 3.

expiresDate.description: Returns 0 if a expiration date is not set

discount_amount.description: The total value of all discounts applied to this item. This includes coupons and cart level discounts

coupon_amount.description: The total value of all coupons applied to this item.

list_price.description: Item's list price, as quoted by the manufacturer/distributor.

sale_price.description: Item's price after all discounts are applied. (The final price before tax calculation.)

extended_list_price.description: Item's list price multiplied by the quantity.

extended_sale_price.description: Item's sale price multiplied by the quantity.

options.description: The list of selected options for this product.

name.description: The product option name. For example, Color or Size

value.description: The product option value. For example, Red or Medium

variant_id.description: The id of the variant. Required in the /PUT or /POST if the product has variants.

product_id.description: The id of the product. Required in a /POST

name.description: The item's product name.

quantity.description: Quantity of this item in the cart.

image_url.description: Image of the product or variant.

download_file_urls.description: URLs to download all product files.

download_page_url.description: The URL for the combined downloads page.

download_size.description: Combined download size, in human-readable style. E.g.: `30MB`.

name.description: GiftCertificate-provided name that will appear in the control panel.

amount.description: Value must be between 1.00 and 1,000.00 in the store's default currency.

items.title: Item Custom
items.description:
Add a custom item to the shoppers cart.

* Custom items are not added to the catalog.
* The price should be set to match the store settings for taxes.

name.description: Item name

list_price.description: Price of the item. With or without tax depending on your stores set up.

created_time.description: Time when the cart was created.

updated_time.description: Time when the cart was last updated.

channel_id.description: If no channel is specified, defaults to 1.

Currency.description: This will always be the same between cart and checkout.

* The price should be set to match the store settings for taxes.

line_items.name: include
line_items.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
